videos.title: Sabrina Carpenter - Espresso (2024)
videos.description: The music video for Sabrina Carpenter's song "Espresso," released in 2024, was directed by Dave Meyers. The video features vibrant and sun-soaked visuals, showcasing Carpenter in various stylish outfits as she navigates a dreamy, retro-inspired setting. With a playful and energetic vibe, the video highlights Carpenter's charisma and the song's catchy, upbeat nature. The creative direction was managed by Jacobi Mehringer and Anna Arnell, adding to the video's polished and dynamic aesthetic.

videos.title: Tiny Cyberpunk 2077 by Flurdeh (2021)
videos.description: Flurdeh specializes in applying a "tilt-shift" effect to video games, transforming their expansive 3D environments into charming miniature dioramas. The videos share common features such as accelerated animations and a lower framerate, enhancing their resemblance to stop-motion animation rather than modern video game footage. An example highlighted is Cyberpunk, where the game's diverse settings are miniaturized, and characters are depicted as if they were tiny figurines engaging in everyday activities.
videos.additional_info:
Tiny Cyberpunk 2077 by Flurdeh (2021)
Flurdeh specializes in applying a "tilt-shift" effect to video games, transforming their expansive 3D environments into charming miniature dioramas. The videos share common features such as accelerated animations and a lower framerate, enhancing their resemblance to stop-motion animation rather than modern video game footage. An example highlighted is Cyberpunk, where the game's diverse settings are miniaturized, and characters are depicted as if they were tiny figurines engaging in everyday activities.
Technique - Dystopian , High Angle , Tilt Shift , Video Game
Editor - Kevin Hensen

videos.title: 21 Savage - redrum (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
videos.additional_info:
21 Savage - redrum (2024)
The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
Technique - High Angle
Director - Danny Seth
DOP - Chewy Lodge, JAWMIDNIGHT, Thomas Marchese
Editor - Alex Liu, Alex Morrison
Colorist - Vlad Barin
Original Source - Link

A mesmerizing music video featuring a chaotic journey initiated by Diplo's spiked chicken nugget, showcasing wild camera angles, unusual characters, and intense visual effects set in a quirky vintage Chinese restaurant. Director Seaman's close collaboration with Francis ensures a deep connection with the song's rhythms and lyrics, bringing to life a vividly demented world that captivates viewers, with or without the influence of LSD.

videos.title: M.I.A. 'Bad Girls' (2012)
videos.description: M.I.A.'s "Bad Girls" music video is a visually stunning showcase of Saudi-inspired car stunts, with drifting vehicles on two wheels and empowered women in a desert setting, blending Middle Eastern cultural elements with modern rebellion. Directed by Romain Gavras, the video highlights themes of female empowerment and defiance, all set against a backdrop of high-octane action and surreal imagery.

videos.title: ONHA - KODAK (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Kodak" by ONHA, directed by Nitram, showcases the artist moving through different lively and surreal environments that correspond to playlists on a girl's phone. In one standout scene, ONHA is turned into a basketball, remaining the focal point during a game. The video is praised for its ambitious concept and impressive visual effects, making it a visually captivating experience.

videos.title: AJ Tracey - Bubble Bath (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Bubble Bath" by AJ Tracey, released in 2024, is set in a lively West London nail shop, directed by LateMilk. The video features vibrant, energetic scenes that reflect the song's upbeat and catchy vibe. It highlights the fusion of contemporary urban culture with playful, colorful visuals, showcasing AJ Tracey in various stylish setups, interacting with people in the nail shop, and performing the song with charisma and flair. The setting and visuals create a fun, engaging atmosphere that complements the track's infectious rhythm and lyrics.

videos.title: Aminé - Charmander (2021)
videos.description: In the 2021 music video "Charmander" by Aminé, the artist retreats to a secluded cabin in the woods, symbolizing a quest for peace and introspection away from the pressures of fame. The video is characterized by a warm, earthy color palette and natural light, capturing the tranquil beauty of the forest setting. The nostalgic reference to Pokémon through the title "Charmander" adds a whimsical contrast to the mature themes of self-discovery and isolation.

videos.title: Tiny Cyberpunk 2077 by Flurdeh (2021)
videos.description: Flurdeh specializes in applying a "tilt-shift" effect to video games, transforming their expansive 3D environments into charming miniature dioramas. The videos share common features such as accelerated animations and a lower framerate, enhancing their resemblance to stop-motion animation rather than modern video game footage. An example highlighted is Cyberpunk, where the game's diverse settings are miniaturized, and characters are depicted as if they were tiny figurines engaging in everyday activities.
videos.additional_info:

videos.title: Usher, H.E.R. - Risk It All (2024)
videos.description: In the 2024 music video 'Risk It All' directed by Dave Meyers, Usher and H.E.R. deliver an emotionally charged performance, underscored by contemporary dance, on a rotating platform in a dimly lit setting. The video, known for its sophisticated yet steamy ambiance, culminates in a poignant moment with Usher tearfully singing the final note. This collaboration is a standout part of 'The Color Purple' soundtrack, showcasing the artistic depth and vulnerability of both artists.
videos.additional_info:

videos.title: Sam Akpro - Death By Entertainment (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Death By Entertainment" by Sam Akpro, directed by Pedro Takahashi, presents the artist and his band as Wall Street-style bankers caught in an endless loop of hard work and intense leisure. The video employs split screens and dynamic camera movements to convey a melancholic yet captivating atmosphere, mirroring the song's themes of repetitive daily life and the blurring lines between day and night due to physical and mental exhaustion.
videos.additional_info:
Sam Akpro - Death By Entertainment (2023)
The music video for "Death By Entertainment" by Sam Akpro, directed by Pedro Takahashi, presents the artist and his band as Wall Street-style bankers caught in an endless loop of hard work and intense leisure. The video employs split screens and dynamic camera movements to convey a melancholic yet captivating atmosphere, mirroring the song's themes of repetitive daily life and the blurring lines between day and night due to physical and mental exhaustion.
Technique - High Angle
Director - Pedro Takahashi
DOP - Max Conran
Colorist - Connor Coolbear, Electric Theatre Collective
Original Source - Link

videos.title: Dua Lipa - Training Season (2024)
videos.description: In the "Training Season" video, Dua Lipa remains composed at a cafe, surrounded by gawking men taking photos of her. The song's inspiration, as shared by Lipa, stemmed from a series of bad dates, leading her to declare the end of her "training season" and shaping the song with songwriters Caroline Ailin and Tobias Jesso Jr.

videos.title: Kendrick Lamar - Humble (2017)
videos.description: The visually striking "Humble" music video, directed by Dave Meyer and reminiscent of Hype Williams' style, breathes life into Kendrick Lamar's ideas, setting the tone for his upcoming album, which appears to focus on his status as a superstar rather than a complex concept.
videos.additional_info:
Kendrick Lamar - Humble (2017)
The visually striking "Humble" music video, directed by Dave Meyer and reminiscent of Hype Williams' style, breathes life into Kendrick Lamar's ideas, setting the tone for his upcoming album, which appears to focus on his status as a superstar rather than a complex concept.
Technique - High Angle , Magical realism , Wide shot
Director - Dave Meyers
DOP - Scott Cunningham
Editor - Greg Scruton
Colorist - Jaime O'Bradovich
